meanings.definition: Having radial symmetry, as in certain flowers.
meanings.sent1: The actinomorphic petals of the daisy were perfectly symmetrical.
meanings.sent2: The sunflower is an actinomorphic flower with petals radiating evenly from the center.
meanings.sent3: The actinomorphic arrangement of the flower made it look like a tiny sun in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her actinomorphic hairstyle, with evenly spaced braids, was a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The actinomorphic design of the snowflake was mesmerizing in its perfect symmetry.

meanings.sent1: The garden showcased a variety of actinomorphic flowers, each with symmetrical petals.
meanings.sent2: The daisy is a common example of an actinomorphic in the floral world.
meanings.sent3: The actinomorphic flower seemed to be waving at the bees buzzing around.
meanings.sent4: The actinomorphic bloom stood out among the wildflowers like a star in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The actinomorphic blossom was a favorite subject for the artist's paintings.

meanings.definition: The actinomorphic structure of a starfish.
meanings.sent1: The actinomorphic arms of the starfish helped it move gracefully along the ocean floor.
meanings.sent2: The biologist studied the actinomorphic features of the starfish in detail.
meanings.sent3: The actinomorphic starfish looked like it was doing a synchronized dance with its arms.
meanings.sent4: The actinomorphic shape of the starfish reminded her of a celestial creature from a myth.
meanings.sent5: The actinomorphic pattern on the starfish's body was a marvel of nature's design.
